title: Lightening Your Music Collection
text: Lightening Your Music Collection , 25 September 2015 -- Have you got some Mp3 files that are simply too big to put on your iPod or Mp3 player? This can be a problem if you're trying to listen to audiobooks or you've got albums that feature hidden tracks which don't play until a huge amount of silence has elapsed at the end of the album. If so, one way to get round the problem is the cut it into smaller pieces. Video Cutter is a digital audio editor which supports not only Mp3's but also WAV, WMA and OGG audio files. It allows you to split any of these formats and rejoin them in whatever way you want. Don't worry about losing sound quality either - Video Cutter uses a compression ratio that means your music will sound just as good when the job is done. A timeline is used to navigate along the file to the point that you want to cut where you simply mark an in and out point. If you want to reduce the file size further, you can also choose to reduce the output rate and lower the frequency of the music. Even you can also cut the audio of a video into individual audio files. It's also worth noting that Video Cutter can convert between Mp3, WAV, WMA and OGG formats so you can use it as a converter, as well as a splitter. It has straightforward operation, simple and clear interface. The software was designed originally to make the people who have little knowledge about cutting video understand all the operation steps at first glance.
